title: Gary Neville and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer in agreement over Man Utd vs Liverpool fixture

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and club legend Gary Neville both see them offering Liverpool a tough test in their next game - despite a miserable run of form.

The Red Devils slipped down to 12th in the Premier League table after being beaten by Newcastle on Sunday.

They are 15 points behind Jurgen Klopp's Liverpool side after they continued their perfect start to the season against Leicester .

The rivals will face-off after the international break at Old Trafford with Liverpool firm favourites - but Solskjaer has branded it a "perfect game" as they look to get back on track.

His sentiments and optimism have been echoed by Neville, who insists it will still be one of Liverpool's toughest games as they enter a crucial period.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"As much as United are in a difficult moment, it's one of their [Liverpool's] toughest games," Neville told Sky Sports .

"Then Liverpool face City in a few weeks as well. Liverpool have games coming up that they could drop points in - they might not."

Discussing the title race, Neville added: "Liverpool are definitely big favourites, but if Van Dijk gets injured, or Salah gets injured it can change.

"There's thirty games to go.

(Image: Getty Images)

"City are not right. They've set such a high standard and the back four is not right. They're conceding chances and they just didn't concede chances last year. They're not like they were.

"They set such a high standard and Liverpool matched that standard last year, barring a hair's width, if City drop below that.

"Not replacing Kompany and the injury to Laporte is a big problem for them.

"They look vulnerable. They haven't shown vulnerability for a few years and people will believe they are."
description: Man Utd will look to bounce back after the international break as they host top of the table Liverpool
